definition: to sever/to break off
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
variant of 絕|绝[jue2]

sentences.english: The diplomatic relations between the two countries have been ruptured.
sentences.chinese: 两国外交关系已经断绝。

sentences.english: She told them how much it grieved her that they were separated.
sentences.chinese: 她们断绝往来，她感到无比难受。

sentences.english: He has threatened to shut himself off from the family.
sentences.chinese: 他威胁要与家庭断绝来往。

sentences.english: Sara has decided to burn bridges with her hot-tempered boyfriend.
sentences.chinese: 莎拉决定和脾气暴躁的男朋友断绝联系。

sentences.english: At the same time, it cut ties with HBGary.
sentences.chinese: 同时，它还与HBGary断绝了来往。

sentences.english: Whoever does work on it, that person is cut off from among his kin.
sentences.chinese: 不管谁在这一天工作，这个人要和他的家族断绝关系。

sentences.english: The woman gave up her lover to save her marriage.
sentences.chinese: 这位女人为了挽救婚姻断绝了与情夫的来往。

sentences.english: The revocation or renunciation of an agency may be made expressly or impliedly by conduct.
sentences.chinese: 废止或断绝代理，可以明示或暗示处理。

sentences.english: I will be through with this man.
sentences.chinese: 我会和这个男人断绝来往。

sentences.english: I was prepared to break up with my family.
sentences.chinese: 我已经做好了与家里断绝关系的准备。

sentences.english: When she found out about our relationship, she cut off communication with him.
sentences.chinese: 当她发现他和我恋爱后，她就断绝了和他的联系。

sentences.english: You can't stop going with an old friend on account of rumors .
sentences.chinese: 你不能因为谣言就和一个老朋友断绝来往。

sentences.english: May his descendants be cut off, their names blotted out from the next generation.
sentences.chinese: 愿他的后人断绝，名字被涂抹，不传于下代。

sentences.english: She broke off with her best friend .
sentences.chinese: 她与自己最好的朋友断绝了往来。

sentences.english: Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.
sentences.chinese: 愿他的后人断绝，名字被涂抹，不传于下代。

sentences.english: We have broken off all ties with that company.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经跟那家公司断绝来往。

definition: to cut off/to sever
to break or cut in two/to sever/to cut off/(fig.) to cut off (a conversation, a flow etc)/to interrupt/(math.) to truncate
cut off/disconnect
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to totally prohibit/to put an end to
to cut off/to chop sth in half
a way out/a way to retreat/leeway
isolated (from the world)/disconnected
lit. two segments with a single cut (idiom)/fig. to make a clean break (idiom)
escape route/retreat route/communication lines to the rear/alternative course of action/room for maneuver
to collapse/to disintegrate/to crumble
to get in touch with/to contact/to stay in contact (with)/liaison/(math.) connection
destruction
tantamount to/to be like
the name remains, but the reality is gone (idiom)
to collapse/to fall apart
